definition: cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
ten (used in fractions, writing checks etc)/assorted/miscellaneous

to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: To do this they had no need to break with Bolshevism.
sentences.chinese: 为了这样做他们无须和布尔什维克主义决裂。

sentences.english: To what extent did the Bolsheviks simply continue policies that the tsarist government was already embracing?
sentences.chinese: 布尔什维克延续俄帝政府固有的政策到怎样的程度？

sentences.english: Kautsky had a special relation to Russia and to Bolshevism.
sentences.chinese: 考茨基与俄国和布尔什维克有着一层特殊的关系。

sentences.english: Stephen Cohen, Bukharin and the Bolshevik Revolution, New York, 1973, p. 223. (
sentences.chinese: 科恩《布哈林与布尔什维克革命》，纽约。

sentences.english: We should learn the wisdom of the Bolsheviks.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学习的是布尔什维克的聪明。

sentences.english: You can call me a non-party Bolshevik.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把我看作是党外布尔什维克吧。

definition: Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Petrograd, variant spelling of 彼得堡[Bi3 de2 bao3], Saint Petersburg
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Aleksandr Kolchak (1874-1920), Russian naval commander, head of anti-Bolshevik White forces
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
